column4: I've just installed ubuntu in windows, inside my laptop. Do i need to install additional stuff to make wireless working???
inside Windows hmm?
You mean Wubi?
yea is that a good idea?
no it isn't a good idea
People can get weird issues with Wubi, also since it's running inside Windows, it won't run as well as a proper Ubuntu install etc
how come?
then i should go back to xp and uninstall wubi

better to do real partitions,   but if Wubi is working for you,  maybe keep it for now to try Ubuntu,  and then put  9.10  on when it's released, with nice default rather fast to bootup  Ext4 file system by default :)
does wubi clean out 100% itself when i uninstall?
dragon rite now i'm updating ubuntu so i have to wait
Does ext4 works for old hd for laptop
For example Dell inspiron 1501
once ubuntu 9.10 verison comes out do we have to format hard drive again? example if i have ext3 would i need to format it to ext4???
I assume yes.

uhmm
